review: Update Oct 2011: Back again for Halloween. Menu still good service was adequate. Update Oct 2010: have come back on Halloween for lunch and it's nice to see the effort has been put in to make the place Halloweeny with balloons, spider webs and Halloween costumes. Good good, delivered well. My Fridays's burger hit the spot perfectly, and so did the New York strip with Jack Daniel's glaze for my wife.

Thought that I would take the kids here over the Christmas period for lunch. I kinda new what to expect so was not expecting too much but it is what it is. We started with the Times Square Player which consisted of Chicken wings, potato skins and motzrella  sticks. This was ok. For the main course my nine year old had a hot dog with fries( boring and plain) which she only ate the chips. I had one of the Tostada stacks which is Cajun chicken, hot sauce and onions and fried veg between layers of tortilla. The wife and other son went for a Jack Daniels chicken burger.  The Tostada was really bland, tortillas were over cooked and it tasted like eating cardboard and left over veg sprayed with a cheap hot sauce. The burgers were dry, too much sauce on and served in a sugary roll. All in all really disappointed with the food and won't ever spend my money there again,
Probably the best ribs in town. Staff are  always friendly and the deserts are killer.

Went to TGI Fridays last night, aaaaaahhhhh you got it all the falls smiles and happiness. lol Had not been to one in a while, and forgot how pricey it is! had the mmmmmmm-ozzarelloa sticks with a marinara sauce ! yum! and for main a12oz  M/R Ribeye steak, fries,veg,pepper sauce (can never have a steak without pepper sauce)!   all in all the service and the food was good, but the price hhhuuummmm 1 beer,1 coke, 2 starters,2 mains                                                                         £45
